author: Paul Hannon
title: Eurozone Business Activity Continues to Slow for Fourth Straight Month
text:
Business activity in the eurozone slowed for the fourth straight month in May and more sharply than expected, a survey of manufacturers and service providers showed, a sign that economic growth has yet to rebound from a surprisingly weak showing in the first quarter.
The eurozone economy entered 2018 on a high, having recorded its fastest expansion in a decade during 2017 as it outpaced the U.S. for the second straight year. But official figures for the first three months of the year recorded a sharp slowdown, which economists...
